website_summaries.verdict: Reviewers rave about the effectiveness and easy installation of this cabin air filters. Unfortunately, it's made only for German vehicles like Volkswagen and Audi.
pros: No tools needed for quick installation
Activated charcoal filtration with consistent performance
Filters out pollen, spores, dust and harmful gases
Optimum ventilation inside the vehicle through low flow resistance
Greatest filtration efficiency through a combination of mechanical and electrostatic attraction

customer_reviews.title: Its a routine maintenance item
customer_reviews.text: My car needed a cabin air filter. Mann filters are what Volkswagen uses from the factory. An the cabin is a often missed filter in scheduled maintenance. I like the Mann filter cabin air with the carbon in the filter(Mann - CUK). The carbon filter is better then the plain cotton filter(Mann – CU). Especially if you have issues with AC box moister issues. The biofuntional filter(Mann – FP) is only for car with activated carbon filter systems. Pay the little extra for the Mann cabin filter with carbon.
customer_reviews.author: K Diggy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Golf Mk 7 as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This won't work with the Golf MK7. Don't trust Amazon's fit checker, it's inaccurate. There are comments from 2 years ago reporting the same issue, but nobody has bothered to update the listing. In my attached photo, the original is in the back. The fit isn't even close!
customer_reviews.author: MI

customer_reviews.title: Home Run!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is better made than the OEM product. This is made in Germany and it is more substantial that the OEM filter in terms of quality and has the added charcoal functionality. Not to mention at a much better price. It is a good value buy. The product fits perfectly and the installation takes less than 10 minutes (if you know what you are doing ... ) Recommend watching the You-tube video on the installation and it is a breeze. Dealership wanted $60 plus taxes (part and labor only) and I saved $50.... feeling smarter and lucky already (albeit my luck does not last long but until then....) Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Old Man Al

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, will keep your cabin fresh and clean smelling.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the same filter as was in my VW. Removal and installation can be done in about 10 minutes, just follow the instructions that come with the filter! It really does make a difference if you change your filter. My cabin smelled like I had cow turds hidden somewhere in my car (the old filter looked like a bird had made a nest in it!) and the morning after I installed this, the small was gone! Do yourself a favor, don't pay your dealer $50 to sell you and install this. Do it yourself and save some $$$!
customer_reviews.author: Buys everything from Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this, both my 2012 Golf TDI and now ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend this, both my 2012 Golf TDI and now 2017 Jetta came factory with a non charcoal filter. These filters get rid of that nasty musty A/C condenser smell and also helps reduce smells that come from outside.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: 2013 and 2016 VW Jetta Hybrid
customer_reviews.text: Works for my two Volkswagen Hybrids. Still smell dead skunkies on my commute, so, this doesn't do anything special in the odor reduction department. But for real, a skunk smell is hard to eliminate. Also, does not keep the smell of smoked cannabis out either, so you will smell it if someone's been smoking it nearby. Also, does not do anything for burning odors while passing through an industrial zone. It fits; it's good. Need more? Pay more.
customer_reviews.author: Boaster

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and fits 2016 VW Jetta
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install - pull up a YouTube video so you don't break any plastic parts. I got it on sale for $10.97 and installed it in 5 minutes. VW recommends every 40k, but with all the junk in there I'm going to replace mine more often. Stock up while they're on sale and do it yourself to save some $$.
customer_reviews.author: Himmy Jiggins

customer_reviews.title: Very easy install / VW Jetta MK6
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2014 Jetta S MK6. It look me 5 minutes to set up, I am NOT at all a car person - I would typically rather just pay someone else to handle this. ..Never again, the entire process took 5 minutes and it made a world of a difference - VW forgot to change my last filter during maintenance, and it started to smell like total ass. Not anymore! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Fixed that funky smell
customer_reviews.text: This filter fit the VW Passat 2015 perfectly. It was an instant fix for the terrible smell coming out the vents in my son’s car. Apparently, you should change these cabin air filters at least annually, especially when the car is driven by a physically active and thus smell-exuding young guy. The funky smells can get trapped up pretty fast in the old dilter and then it gets recirculated back into the car. Blech! Not too hard to change it out either.
customer_reviews.author: ElPrimero

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and seems effective and pulling junk out of the air.
customer_reviews.text: Similar to the Mann air filter and and oil filter, for my 2012 VW Jetta TDI, this appears to match the OEM product. I actually went with the activated charcoal after I managed to leave some frozen chicken in my car for a couple of days in the hot desert sun and had some lingering not so great odor in my car. I cannot say if time or the filter did it, but I have been sticking with these since then. I change them out a bit more often due to living a dusty environment. Fit is perfect and they capture quite a bit of dust and particulate.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor W

customer_reviews.title: Works and Fits Fine
customer_reviews.text: This cabin filter went in and works fine. Quality appears to be as good as the OEM filter. One suggestion would be that their instructions could use some verbiage. Was a little tricky figuring out how to install as this was the first time for me. Other than that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard N

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT MK7 GOLF R!!
customer_reviews.text: This DOES NOT fit a 2015 Golf R. Already started the process of returning it. Misleading and downright inaccurate item description. Disappointed, Amazon. Glad it only took me 2 minutes to open the cabin air box in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 2017 VW(Volkswagen) Jetta just fine. My car dealer usually tries to charge me 70$ everytime I go to him for any service, to change this filter. After watching a How-to video on YouTube, I was able to change it myself within 20 minutes. It can be a pain to change due to location, not the filter itself. The filter fit perfectly and I had no issues installing it.
customer_reviews.author: audrey

customer_reviews.title: Freshens up your car!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used Jetta and it had a very strong funky smell inside. I tried waiting it out for a few weeks, driving with the windows down and the fan full blast, air fresheners, and even burning incense as a last resort. Nothing worked! That is until I simply replaced the air filter with this one. I think the activated carbon really did the trick, because after a few days the cabin was nearly scent free!
customer_reviews.author: Lars SveenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 2012 Jetta Sportwagen
customer_reviews.text: Fits just fine in our 2012 Jetta Sportwagen SE. The replacement was fairly easy, the filter itself is just located in an awkward position underneath the glove box. You have to get down (almost upside down) in the foot well to remove the trim and get access to the filter box.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Decent cabin air filter
customer_reviews.text: There really isn't much to say about this filter: it just works. Would recommend this particular one (with carbon) over the slightly less expensive one without it because, and while I can't quantify it with some fancy gauge/tool, this particular filter has done better in my 200K+ mile vehicle than any other filters I've tried during the vehicle's lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Value and quality in a name brand filter
customer_reviews.text: Best value and easy to change. Saved me a lot of money doing it myself. Most times the dealers have dirty used filters on a shelf that they bring out to show you, telling you you need it changed, when you probably dont, just to pad your service bill.
customer_reviews.author: PAT L

customer_reviews.title: Improved air quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used a 06 vw passat. The heat and ac air didn't stink but was making me cough after running for a few minutes. Replaced the filter with this one and noticed an immediate difference in air quality and no more of whatever was making me cough. Will by again.
customer_reviews.author: Chanel

customer_reviews.title: Good fit & quality
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Fit easily into my 2012 VW. I watched the videos on Youtube on how to change the filter. This brand makes good quality filters & it's much cheaper to buy them on Amazon than to go to the dealer. I hear good things about charcoal in filters so I'm hoping it will provide me with good air while driving!
customer_reviews.author: Cautious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect filter, perfect price.
customer_reviews.text: best filter at best price. do not let quick oil change places con you into a $30 or $40 cabin air filter!! installs are five minutes and require no tools or a simple screwdriver. If you can change a lightbulb, you can change your cabin air filter, saving $20-$30.
customer_reviews.author: TruthBeTold71

customer_reviews.title: My VW dealership wanted to charge me $55 to replace ...
customer_reviews.text: My VW dealership wanted to charge me $55 to replace this cabin filter in my car. I noticed the OE version was made in France while this Mann replacement filter was made in Germany. Fits perfectly with replacement needed absolutely zero tools. It took around 3 minutes. Have a vacuum cleaner handy to clean up the dirt that falls out when pulling the old filter out.
customer_reviews.author: joshhan

customer_reviews.title: works and fits!
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to install, and it fits better than the filter brand I used last time (can't remember what it was, but it wasn't this). And, prob because of the better fit, it better filters out bad exhaust odors and such.
customer_reviews.author: Marc A. Razze

customer_reviews.title: Same great quality as OEM, 1/10th the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this product. Bought this for my 2016 VW Jetta 1.8TSI after hitting 20K on the odometer. Got a quote a quote from the VW Dealership one day during oil change and they wanted $90 (YIKES) for a new cabin filter and the install. You don't need an OEM part for a cabin air filter. This MANN Filter is great and installation is a breeze - literally a five minute job with a single tool.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. (2012 Golf 2.5L). Always replace these every year or two. Makes a difference in air quality in the cabin. At least for where I live. Do yourself a favor and change yours. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, no stink
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to get the screws out under the dash, but that's nothing to do with the filter. The new filter went in easily and has resolved the occasional foul smell in the car.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Mann Cabin Air Filter fits my 2013 VW Passat TDI just fine.
customer_reviews.text: This fit my 2013 TDI Passat just fine. Just a little wiggle to snug it into place. I'm glad that I changed it as it was filled with dust and even some small leaves. I'm not sure, but I believe this was the first time it was changed... I'm at 42,600 miles. I am also pleased with Amazon and their "garage." I had added my Passat to the garage, and Amazon would tell me if the part that I was looking at would fit my car. They confirmed that the oil filter, the cabin filter and the engine air filter would fit my car... And they all did. Nice double check before you order car parts.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stolz

customer_reviews.title: It fit..
customer_reviews.text: The 2013 Audi A3 we bought stunk so bad inside so the first thing we did was change the pollen filter. Fit perfectly and the smell went away.
customer_reviews.author: Calidjone

customer_reviews.title: VW cabin filter replacement
customer_reviews.text: Good product overall, can't complain. It's the OEM filter for my 2008 VW Rabbit. They included a pamphlet that had pictures of the interior of my car and how to take out the old filter. It's very straightforward. The only hassle really is the car and not the filter; installation is awkward b/c it's under the dashboard and all. The foam insert is a little difficult to put back into place. With that said, it was about a 10 minute job, vacuuming included (the old filter let's out all kind of stuff).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fix to musty AC smell
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for our 2013 VW GTI. Took handy husband only a few moments to install and musty AC smell was eliminated. Will definitely change it more routinely, especially at this price. Thieving dealership wanted an arm and a leg for this service!!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Stock replacement part, much cheaper than the dealer
customer_reviews.text: It's the stock replacement part for this model, install varies depending on your vehicle. Does not have a scent, though j suppose you could apply your preferred oderant if you wanted to.
customer_reviews.author: M Squared

customer_reviews.title: it's easy.
customer_reviews.text: The angled part of the filter goes towards the passenger side of the car iirc. The base plastic plate has two offset hooks that match up with the offset slots in the base of the filter. The VW dealer that the previous owner had do all the maintenance had the filter installed backwards and basically they just shoved it in the slot and jimmied the base plate back in place.. Do it yourself, it's easy.
customer_reviews.author: Notabiker

customer_reviews.title: Good Product as always from MANN
customer_reviews.text: these seem to fit quite a few different vw products i use this one in my family's and my own jetta, tiguan, and passat. I replace my filter about once every 6 months personal preference but these would last at least a year depending on how much you have your windows down or are in a dusty environment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit For 2014 VW
customer_reviews.text: My GTI's a/c had a musty smell at 25k miles, so this was an easy solution. It's hot and humid in central Texas and the filter works overtime. Took about five whole minutes following the included directions and the quality of the filter is better than the original factory installed variety. Highly recommend. PS - This is my 9th VW over the past 24 years.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Chiller

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2015 MK6 Facelift GLI
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my factory filter with this one and it fit perfectly. Seems to do what it's supposed to being a filter and all. Save a few bucks, buy this for your Jetta/GLI and install it yourself. It only takes a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit OEM replacement!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Since this is for my complicated German car I just youtubed "<my car> cabin filter replace". 15-min later all good! Don't know why I waited this long, my previous filter was filthy. Compare Genuine Audi (Valeo) vs OEM (Mann). Save some $.
customer_reviews.author: D and R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: OEM fit. Easy to install. Fits my 2015 Jetta perfect. I replace it every 18 months. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ScareMe

customer_reviews.title: Great OEM Replacement Filter!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2015 Passat SE 1.8TSI and the filter fits perfectly. The activated charcoal is a nice touch compared to the flimsy, overpriced crap VW uses as their OEM filter. Would definitely recommend. Price was good and fast shipping. Will save this to buy again as I can't get this filter in any local auto stores. Installation was also pretty simple too. Not the biggest fan of where/how VW has their cabin filter accessible, but I've seen worse. Also this filter says "Made in Germany" on it. Not sure why Amazon says it's made in china in the item details.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Original cabin filter for VW Passat 2012
customer_reviews.text: Original cabin filter for VW Passat 2012 TDI, very easy to install. Save $20 and install it yourself instead of paying the dealer.
customer_reviews.author: C. G.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy plenty of YouTube videos.
customer_reviews.text: VERY EASY TO INSTALL way cheaper then going to the dealership. Trust me if you can turn a wing nut and pull down and then push up you can do this. I also used YouTube videos.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change. High quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'd recommend changing your cabin air filter every year. Very important. Do it yourself and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Exellent product
customer_reviews.text: Recently replaced the cabin filter in my Audi and the Mann Filter is the same as the Audi original part. That being said I trust that this one will last as long as the original one. I have used Mann Filters for years and they deliver always good quality. I never had an issue with them. Other reviewers complaint that the housing is not stable enough. I personally found that very helpful becasue it made it easier to replce the filter. The filter in my Audi sits under the glove box and you are almost making a hand stand to open the little compartment. Anyhting boxier would have made the change more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: jensinnzl

customer_reviews.title: A fine brand at a good price and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Received this on time, unbeknownst to shipper or Amazon where I continually see a message indicating it hasn't arrived. Otherwise a fine brand, arrived in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Factory Filter - Simple To Change
customer_reviews.text: These are the cabin air filters used in some VW vehicles and instructions on how to change it comes in the box. You can look on Youtube and see how to change your cabin air filter and you'll be shocked what the dealer is charging you. Honestly if you can change a lightbulb you can probably change your cabin air filter. This is the same quality part used by VW (Mann filters) so it's certainly what your car came with from the factory.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harron

customer_reviews.title: Fit Your Own!
customer_reviews.text: As easy as cabin air filters are to change, why let a dealer overcharge you to do the job? This is a good value and a good filter!
customer_reviews.author: TWJ

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!!!!  Smell is gone!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had a awful smell coming from my vents!! Pulled the old one and it was funky!!!! Replaced and the smell is gone!! Determined it was rotting leaves, sticks and debris. Very happy I purchased this!!
customer_reviews.author: Batch

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement to OEM
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement to OEM , and priced much lower than dealer prices . Mann actually makes for dealers anyhow
customer_reviews.author: T C

customer_reviews.title: Easy Do-it-yourself Cabin Air Filter Change for Jetta Sportwagen
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why you would pay the dealer premium prices to replace a filter that you can do on your own in a matter of minutes. The only tricky part on my Jetta Sportwagen 2011 is being careful not to strip the plastic screw that holds the faceplate under the glove compartment that gives you access to the filter port. I never bother changing the cabin filter when paying dealer prices, but I find that the it is worth the cost of the filter to change it on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Mike

customer_reviews.title: Get yours now
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value, I was a third the cost of a store bought filter, and a five times less expensive than the dealership
customer_reviews.author: Mark Barrett

customer_reviews.title: OEM Amazing Filter
customer_reviews.text: This filter works great! Makes the air smell like nothing is there, due to the active carbon. My only complaint is that it came with little tears in the surrounding frame due to shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gower

customer_reviews.title: New car smell
customer_reviews.text: I like this. No more musty smell in my car. It fit nicely, though putting it in was unexpectedly fussy. But installation definitely was easy overall. Have a Beetle 2014 by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Aldee

customer_reviews.title: but bought it anyway and it came in perfect condition and fit perfectly into my VW 2012 Passat
customer_reviews.text: Was unsure about buying this one after seeing it was "made in china" and the other reviewers pictures of the messed up filters, but bought it anyway and it came in perfect condition and fit perfectly into my VW 2012 Passat. Don't bother going to a dealership to install this, there are plenty of youtube videos and the installation takes less than 20 minutes. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Park

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement part
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have you vehicle in “my garage” in Amazon account settings, do it. Perfect fit every item I need for my car. This filter is the exact replacement and fo $70 less than the dealer would charge to do a 10 minute job!!
customer_reviews.author: john reno

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement cabin air filter for 2006 VW GLI
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace the last dealer-installed cabin air filter in my 2006 VW GLI, and it fit perfectly. If I had known how cheap these things are and how (relatively) easy it is to replace them, I would have been doing this myself for years instead of paying $50-60 for a body shop to do it. This one seemed noticeably thicker/heavier than the filter I took out, which seemed a little flimsy. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a replacement cabin filter for his 2013 Passat, and I chose this one based on its reviews. It appears to be a quality item and it fits, so it’s a winner in my book!
customer_reviews.author: sassymimama

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly and much cheaper than what the stealership wanted. No screwdriver required. It probably took me 3 minutes total and I've never changed one before. I can probably do it in 60-90 seconds now that I've done it once.
customer_reviews.author: BeachBunny

customer_reviews.title: It's a good pick
customer_reviews.text: No need to pay higher price to fix a filter. Install it yourself. Looks promising. No problem so far.
customer_reviews.author: Supun B Attanayake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my 2010 VW CC
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking it's time to change your filter chances are it's past time to change it. Very overlooked part but can really change your comfort level in your car. Perfect fit for my 2010 VW CC.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Always change your own air filters, especially this one on your VW.
customer_reviews.text: This filter definitely looks like the OEM filter that VW used on my wife's Jetta. And I'm glad I took it upon myself to replace it, because the VW dealership that replaced it last had installed it incorrectly! They jammed the base all the way into the filter slot. They didn't know that the base sits flush at the bottom in order for the locking piece to line up properly with the slots, creating a nice seal. Amateurs with certs, love it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2015 Jetta 1.8 tsi.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly in my 2015 VW Jetta 1.8 tsi. Original one didn't have charcoal in it but this one does. Install was easy too. Changed it at 32,000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Mac131

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It would have been fantastic, had I been able to enjoy it for more than a day. I replaced my filter literally the day before I replaced the car
customer_reviews.author: Allysan M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay the Dealer for this, you too can have that new car smell back!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome replacement! Give you that NEW car smell back ! My car was starting to smell a bit musty and dirty so I ordered this , gave my car a full detail and replaced the factory one and it truly gave me back that new car smell I love ( clean and bright) . Perfect replacement for original and about 80$ cheaper than getting it done at the "stealer"
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Replacement Filter - They Made Filters for OEMs, why not.
customer_reviews.text: Quality, Easy to install. Durable. And a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: CNJ Guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to change out
customer_reviews.text: This is the original type mfg type filter and it was so easy to R&R old for new, is improved and had no problem in the change process.
customer_reviews.author: Dee6978

customer_reviews.title: I guess it does what it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: The ones I got out from the filter housings were installed by the dealer, and those OEM ones had much sturdier side walls. These (I got a 2 in 1 pack) bent while I was trying to install them. Lower quality (flimsier) compared to OEMs.
customer_reviews.author: John_N

customer_reviews.title: Save a fortune by not buying this at the dealership
customer_reviews.text: This item is exactly what I was looking for, I thought it was an excellent value in the packing and service I received was excellent
customer_reviews.author: H. S. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Same as the OEM VW
customer_reviews.text: Same as the oem vw filter. I can't really tell any difference between before and after changing but the old one was really dirty. I assume it will filter as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Fit well in my 2012 Jetta. Not clear as to air-flow direction instructions, though. Local oil change shop wanted $34 to replace the filter. Took me less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in a 2017 Jetta. Can't really comment on the performance, but I haven't noticed any weird smells so I suppose it's doing the trick.
customer_reviews.author: P M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Made in Germany, and at fraction of the cost compared to auto store or dealer. Fit perfectly in my Golf.
customer_reviews.author: nightwish224

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: Great little filter and was super easy to swap out. It's on my list to buy again next time.
customer_reviews.author: J Walton

customer_reviews.title: OEM Product
customer_reviews.text: OEM product that arrived quickly and fit as it should! does a great job filtering the external air as it enters the cabin. super easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: Justin E Bender

customer_reviews.title: Install was very easy on 2011 VW GTI
customer_reviews.text: Install was very easy on 2011 VW GTI. Beware lots of dust will fall on your face when you remove the old one! Check out the before and after photo. You can guess which one is which!
customer_reviews.author: Desmond

customer_reviews.title: OEM filter
customer_reviews.text: This is the OEM cabin filter for Jetta MK6. Much cheaper than getting from the authorized dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Rock Auto is better
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a similar product from Rock Auto last change. The item from Rock Auto was of greater quality and characterized better sealing qualities. I gues it is what it is for Prime 2 day shipping. For a charcoal activated filter, one would expect it to be sealed in a vacuum Plastic bag. Rock Auto next time.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Soso
customer_reviews.text: I mean it works not the greatest not the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Shato Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great price, fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Great filter for your 2007-2012 (only cars I've tested it on are an 09 Jetta 2.5 and an '07 Rabbit, '08 Rabbit, '09 GTI, 2012 Golf) Fits them all perfectly. Charcoal activation, ensuring odors get destroyed. Only con is the design of the filter housing and the way air enters the car from above. Debris from the rain try gets caught and falls down into the filter so dust this puppy out once in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: invalidusername

customer_reviews.title: Great filter great price
customer_reviews.text: NEVER pay a dealership to do this filter again! 10 min and its done!! Plug and play! works like a champ. Save a ton of money and don't pay the dealerships to change ANY of your filters - YOU CAN DO IT!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Save big and DIY
customer_reviews.text: It’s just like the oem filter perfect fit less than 5 minutes to change and saved 75 dollars on repair shop price.
customer_reviews.author: judd in illinois.

customer_reviews.title: Made my car smell great again!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first cabin filter I've replaced. My car has 65k miles, and was the old filter dirty!! I am definitely adding changing this filter to my preventative maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Steel Rod

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and price.
customer_reviews.text: A perfect fit had instructions inside the box. Saved me big bucks. Would have cost at least $75.00 to have done at the dealership and that was a special with online coupon. Was not able to find this item at the local parts stores that would have ordered it for me for twice the price. This only took about 10 minutes to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L. Welch

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit my car, though it initially said it did
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's because this did fit a car I once owned, but when I searched for the filter for my 15 Golf Sportwagen TDI this filter was listed so I purchased it no questions. Unfortunately, it doesn't fit my year model. So I'll find a friend to give this one to.
customer_reviews.author: Huutsi

customer_reviews.title: Great price!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this cabin filter for a my car almost a year ago and still works great. The price is definitely a bargain and I'm more than happy to say that it was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: celestino

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the same filter that the factory uses in VWs but for less money works perfect and doesn’t have a funky smell.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one I replaced in my Audi
customer_reviews.text: The filter appears to be the same one that was in my 2015 Audi Q3. Easy to install. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: COULD NOT HAVE BEEN BETTER  WORKS AND FITS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Just what we wanted and the only thing easy to do with this Passat!
customer_reviews.author: Herbie Pitchford

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and cheaper then the dealer
customer_reviews.text: It would have cost me about $125 for dealer to install this filter and my car would have been with them at least 2 hours. Using video on Youtube I did it my self in 5 minutes. With the fires in Calif. this helped to get the smoky smell out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the dealership
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those things that you can save a bundle on doing yourself compared to the dealership, and it's literally a 2 minute job. Hardest part is locating where your filter is in your cabin - usually somewhere under or around your glove compartment. Then it's simply a matter of undoing a couple of plastic screws, dropping the old one out and sticking the new one in. You'll want a handvac handy to take care of any debris from the used filter.
customer_reviews.author: M. Howells

customer_reviews.title: Satisfies customer
customer_reviews.text: My car AC began to release a horrid smell! (VW CC) I did my research and discovered the air cabin filter should be changed as well as use Kilma cleaner. WELL I bought the filter removed the old one installed the new one which took no more that 10 minutes. I never used the spray AC cleaner and the odor instantly was gone. Great product, easy fix, awesome price!
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie B.

customer_reviews.title: OEM quality and better
customer_reviews.text: This is OEM quality and has active carbon to absorb more fumes than regular filters. The only complaint I have is that it doesn't come sealed in a plastic bag, so it will start absorbing smells as soon as you open the box or have it stored as I do until I need to replace my filter. Other filters usually are sealed in plastic to extend their life and keep them from absorbing odors in shipment or in storage.
customer_reviews.author: c los

customer_reviews.title: I'm using Mann for the life of my Jetta!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality filter that is much better than the OEM type that your Volkswagen or Audi dealership would use as a replacement. Activated charcoal is always your best bet! To my knowledge the dealerships use standard filters. At least my old OEM filter sure looked standard!
customer_reviews.author: David Mooney

customer_reviews.title: It fit, that's all I really cared about
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in my 2006 VW Passat 2.0T and saved me quite a bit over what the dealer wanted to replace it. I have used Mann Filters before and they seem to work just as well as the "name brands" like Fram. I am not sure if the charcoal does anything at all, though, or if it's a gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I have in the car.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I have in the car but at less price.
customer_reviews.author: PABLO VILLEGAS

customer_reviews.title: Mann filters are great for VW's
customer_reviews.text: Mann filters are great for VW's. Great price and oem fit. Works like a charm. Can't believe how yuckky the old one was. Installation requires you to be as bendable as a Chinese acrobat and if you wear glasses that are variable lens, good luck. The product is great it's just the placement of the filter that makes it tough. Check out YouTube if you have questions on the install. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: zagato27

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2011 VW Golf.
customer_reviews.text: In humid areas the factory filters will retain moisture and begin to mildew over time. This will spread a stinky foot smell about your vehicle cabin. Replacing the filter should fix this problem. This filter contains charcoal, which should also help remove odor. The fitment is exactly like the one that came out of my VW.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Dino

customer_reviews.title: EXACT replacement for the factory cabin air filter.
customer_reviews.text: The stock filter was a Mann CUK 2939, and it performed well. This replacement was made in Germany, and the stock one in Mexico. What's not to like about that? The seal fit perfectly and snugly, and I am confident that this is the best value for a quality filter available on the market. I live in a very dusty climate in eastern Washington state, and I will definitely buy another in 15,000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: shooterjim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and fit perfect
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Mann Cabin Filter to replace the one in my 2008 VW EOS. It fit perfect and was easy to install. Shipping was very quick. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: csites

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Easy to install. Fits perfectly! My car smells like it should again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: Had a bad odor in my car and when I replaced to this filter, man what a difference. Fresh air. If anyone buys a new car first thing I recommend everyone to do is replace to cabin air filter. This brand is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, dont even need tools. No more strange scents outta the air vents
customer_reviews.author: Renato P Adriano Jr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value
customer_reviews.text: High quality filter replacement. As others have noted it does not come in a plastic bag, etc. So i'm not sure of the charcoal is compromised. Otherwise the filter is very solid and sturdy and fit was exact. I use Mann for all my filters on my '12 GTI. For the price, none compare.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

product_meta.title: Mann-Filter CUK 2939 Cabin Filter With Activated Charcoal for select Audi/Volkswagen models
product_meta.description: Like a sponge, the activated charcoal layer embedded in the non-woven material absorbs harmful gases such as nitrogen dioxide, fuels and ozone into pores which are 10,000 times finer than a human hair. That is how the combi-filter ensures a healthy cabin environment. This modern filter consists of a non-woven-based particle filter media, an activated charcoal layer and a carrier media to improve stability
feature_bullets: Filters out pollen, spores, dust and harmful gases
Optimum ventilation inside the vehicle through low flow resistance
Consistent filtration performance throughout the entire service interval
Greatest filtration efficiency through a combination of mechanical and electrostatic attraction

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,841 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
